name: acceptEvent
description: Accept the specified event invitation in a user's calendar.

userId.description: The ID or userPrincipalName of the user.

eventId.description: The ID of the event to accept.

comment.description: Optional text included in the response.

sendResponse.description: Whether to send a response to the organizer.

name: cancelEvent
description: Cancel an event in a specified user's calendar and notify attendees.

userId.description: The ID or userPrincipalName of the user who owns the event.

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to cancel.

comment.description: Optional message to include in the cancellation notification to attendees.

name: createEvent
description: "Use this to create a new event in current user's calendar. IMPORTANT: If recipient names are provided instead of email addresses, you MUST first search for users to find their email addresses..If time is provided, schedule the event — even if there are conflicts/ even if attendee/organizer is busy in that slot.If only a date is given, use the earliest slot where all or most attendees (> 50% of them) are free. If no date is given, schedule meeting at given time for today.If no time/date is given, use the first slot where all attendees are free.Try to create events during working hours of signed-in user (8 AM – 5 PM) if explicit time is not specified.Specify recurrence using recurrence property.Online meetings can be created by setting isOnlineMeeting to true.Default meeting duration is 30 minutes, if not specified by user."

userId.description: Use current user if no organizer is specified.If not, get the organizer's user principal name first, and use that value.'

subject.description: Non-empty event subject/title. Avoid trailing whitespace and control characters.

body.description: Event body/description content. Use 'html' for rich formatting or 'text' for plain.

contentType.description: Body content type. If unsure, use 'Text'.

content.description: Body content string. For 'html', provide well-formed HTML; for 'text', provide plain UTF-8 text.

start.description: Event start timestamp with time zone. Must be today or after.

dateTime.description: Event start time in ISO 8601 without offset: 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss' (e.g., '2025-09-18T09:00:00').

timeZone.description: Time zone identifier for start time. Use the system time zone if known.

end.description: Event end timestamp with time zone. Must be after 'start'.

dateTime.description: Event end time in ISO 8601 without offset: 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss' (e.g., '2025-09-18T10:00:00').

timeZone.description: Time zone identifier of 'dateTime'. Use the same timeZone as 'start.timeZone' for consistency.

location.description: Primary location for the event. Use a concise name (e.g., room name, address, or 'Microsoft Teams Meeting').If not specified, default to 'Microsoft Team Meeting'

displayName.description: Human-readable location label (e.g., 'Conf Room 12A', '1 Microsoft Way, Redmond', or 'Teams Meeting').

attendees_addresses.description: Email addresses of attendees. Each must be a valid email address.

attendees_types.description: Attendee roles corresponding to each address in 'attendees_addresses'. Must appear in the same order as the email array so that each type applies to the attendee at the same index.

attendees_names.description: Display names of attendees corresponding to each address in 'attendees_addresses'. Must appear in the same order as the email array so that each name applies to the attendee at the same index.

recurrence.description: Recurrence specification. Provide both 'pattern' and 'range'. Omit for one-time events.

interval.description: The time interval between occurrences (e.g., every 2 weeks)

daysOfWeek.description: Days of the week for recurrence, if applicable

dayOfMonth.description: Day of the month for monthly pattern

startDate.description: The start date of the recurrence (yyyy-MM-dd)

endDate.description: The end date of the recurrence (yyyy-MM-dd)

numberOfOccurrences.description: The number of times the event occurs

allowNewTimeProposals.description: Whether invitees can propose a new time. Defaults to true if omitted.

transactionId.description: Optional unique client-provided identifier to ensure idempotence

isOnlineMeeting.description: Set to true to create an online meeting. Defaults to false.

onlineMeetingProvider.description: Online meeting provider. REQUIRED when 'isOnlineMeeting' = true; omit otherwise.

name: declineEvent
description: Decline the specified event invitation in a user's calendar.

userId.description: The ID or userPrincipalName of the user.

eventId.description: The ID of the event to decline.

comment.description: Optional text included in the response.

sendResponse.description: Whether to send a response to the organizer.

name: deleteEvent
description: Delete an event from a specified user's calendar.

userId.description: The ID or userPrincipalName of the user whose event is being deleted.

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to delete.

name: findMeetingTimes
description: Suggest possible meeting times and locations based on organizer and attendee availability. Use only when the user requests to find an open time slot for a new meeting (e.g., 'schedule a meeting', 'find a slot', 'when can we meet'). Do not use this tool for locating or updating existing meetings.

userId.description: The ID or userPrincipalName of the organizer.

attendees_addresses.description: Email addresses of attendees for meeting time suggestions. Each must be a valid email address.

attendees_types.description: Attendee types corresponding to each address in 'attendees_addresses'. Must appear in the same order as the email array so that each type applies to the attendee at the same index.

attendees_names.description: Display names of attendees corresponding to each address in 'attendees_addresses'. Must appear in the same order as the email array so that each name applies to the attendee at the same index.

responseTemplate: Meeting time suggestions found for duration {{meetingDuration}} (mock).

name: getEvent
description: Get a single calendar event from a specified user’s calendar.

userId.description: The ID or userPrincipalName of the user whose event is being retrieved.

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event.

select.description: OData $select query parameter to specify returned properties.

expand.description: OData $expand query parameter to include navigation properties like exceptionOccurrences.

name: getOrganization
description: Retrieve the properties and relationships of the specified organization (tenant). Supports $select to choose specific fields.

organizationId.description: The ID of the organization (tenant) to retrieve.

select.description: Comma-separated list of organization properties to return (via $select).

name: getSchedule
description: Get the free/busy schedule for a user, distribution list, or resource.

userId.description: The ID or userPrincipalName of the user.

schedules.description: SMTP addresses of users or resources.

startTime.description: Start time for the query. Should be today / after today. Use system timezone if not specified.

endTime.description: End time for the query.Should be after startTime. Use system timezone if not specified

name: listCalendarView
description: Retrieve events from a user's calendar view. Use this tool whenever you need to retrieve  one meeting instance of a recurrening event(not master series) occurring in a window (e.g., 'tomorrow morning' or 'between 2 PM and 4 PM') before calling any tool that modifies, updates, or cancels a meeting.

startDateTime.description: Start of the time range (ISO 8601). Should be today / after today.

endDateTime.description: End of the time range (ISO 8601).should be after startDateTime.

top.description: Max number of events to return.

name: listEvents
description: Retrieve a list of events in a user's calendar.For recurring meetings, only return one / first record with full recurrence details (pattern, start, end) to the agent.For searching by meeting title, filter using contains(subject,'X'); avoid 'eq' or startswith(subject,'X') filter for this case.Use this tool to find existing meetings whenever the user refers to a meeting by day, date, time , or title (e.g., “add someone to the architecture review at 2 PM”), before calling any tool that modifies, updates, or cancels a meeting.

userId.description: If no organizer is specified, use current user. If organizer is explicitly mentioned - retrieve their user principal name and use that value.

startDateTime.description: The start of the time range for the events (ISO 8601 format). Should be today / after today.

endDateTime.description: The end of the time range for the events (ISO 8601 format). Should be after the startTime

top.description: The maximum number of events to return.

filter.description: OData filter query to filter events.Filter by the date, time, day if supplied in the input prompt.

orderby.description: OData order by query to sort events.

name: updateEvent
description: Update an existing calendar event in a specified user's calendar. Address of the attendees should be a valid email address.IMPORTANT: If recipient names are provided instead of email addresses, you MUST first search for users to find their email addresses.

userId.description: The ID or userPrincipalName of the user whose event is being updated.

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to update.

subject.description: The updated subject of the event.

body.description: The updated body content of the event.

contentType.description: The content type of the body.

start.description: Updated start time of the event.

dateTime.description: Start date and time in ISO format.

timeZone.description: Time zone for the start time.Use the system timezone if not explictly specified.

end.description: Updated end time of the event.

dateTime.description: End date and time in ISO format.

timeZone.description: Time zone for the end time. Should be same as the start timezone.

attendees_addresses.description: Email addresses of updated attendees. Each must be a valid email address.

attendees_types.description: Attendee types corresponding to each address in 'attendees_addresses'. Must appear in the same order as the email array so that each type applies to the attendee at the same index.

attendees_names.description: Display names of attendees corresponding to each address in 'attendees_addresses'. Must appear in the same order as the email array so that each name applies to the attendee at the same index.

isCancelled.description: Set to true to cancel the event.

recurrence.description: Defines the recurrence pattern and range for the event.Default duration is 6 months.

daysOfWeek.description: The days of the week for the recurrence.

dayOfMonth.description: The day of the month for the recurrence.

month.description: The month for the yearly pattern.

type.description: The recurrence range type. Default duration is 6 months.

startDate.description: The date to start the recurrence (yyyy-mm-dd). Should be today / after today.

endDate.description: The date to end the recurrence (yyyy-mm-dd). should be after startDate

numberOfOccurrences.description: The number of times to repeat.
